description: Students learn special topics in dance in a movement intensive environment.  Students study the
historical, social, and cultural context in which the dance topic emerged and currently functions
and the physical and expressive capacities that distinguish it from other forms.  Dance topics
could include somatics, Gaga, contact improvisation, yoga, partnering, or aerial dance.  Topics
may vary from year to year.   May be repeated. P/N only. Offered each semester. No prerequisite.
fullname: Topics in Movement Studies in Dance (0.25)
shortname: Top: Hip Hop Dance and History
